title: DNB Posts Forecast-Beating Rise in 3Q Net Profit, Launches Share Buyback
text:
By Dominic Chopping

DNB ASA (DNB.OS) on Thursday posted a forecast-beating 5.7% rise in third-quarter net profit and said it will start a new share buyback program of up to 7.9 million shares.

A strong Norwegian macroeconomic situation contributed to healthy lending growth, higher NOK interest rates and continued strong asset quality, the bank said.

Norway's largest lender made a profit attributable to shareholders of 5.75 billion Norwegian kroner ($628 million) compared with NOK5.44 billion a year earlier, while net interest income rose 9.1% to NOK9.98 billion.

Analysts polled by FactSet had expected net profit of NOK5.6 billion with net interest income of NOK9.93 billion.

DNB's common equity Tier 1 capital ratio--a measure of a bank's financial strength--rose to 16.9% from 16.5%.

The bank said it saw higher volumes in all customer segments and positive effects from repricing in the quarter. There was an average increase in the healthy loan portfolio of 5.4% parallel to a 0.5 per cent increase in average deposit volumes from the first three quarters of 2018, it added. It posted net impairments of NOK1.25 billion.

The fourth rate hike from Norges Bank from 1.25% to 1.5% in September, and DNB's subsequent announcement of increased loan rates, will have a positive effect on net interest income from the fourth quarter, with full effect from the first quarter of 2020, the bank said.

The bank still expects an annual increase in lending volumes of 3% to 4% in 2020. In this period, DNB expects higher growth in lending volume for small- and medium-sized enterprises and slower-paced growth in lending to large corporates and international customers.
